Abstract: This review highlights recent advancements in computational methods for single-cell proteomics, focusing on mass cytometry and spatial proteomics. We discuss innovative data analysis techniques, including clustering algorithms and trajectory inference, which enable the detailed characterization of cellular heterogeneity and dynamic processes. These methods facilitate the integration of multi-omic data, enhancing our understanding of complex biological systems at the single-cell level. The application of these computational tools is crucial for advancing personalized medicine and systems biology.
